meanings.definition: A person who is unable to pay their debts.
meanings.sent1: The insolvents struggled to make ends meet.
meanings.sent2: The company had to declare bankruptcy due to many insolvents.
meanings.sent3: The insolvents formed a support group to help each other out.
meanings.sent4: The weight of debt felt like a heavy burden on the insolvents' shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The image of the insolvents pleading with creditors was heartbreaking.

meanings.definition: A substance that does not dissolve in a particular solvent.
meanings.sent1: Oil is an example of insolvents in water.
meanings.sent2: The chemist conducted experiments to identify insolvents in the solution.
meanings.sent3: The insolvents in the mixture stubbornly refused to mix.
meanings.sent4: The insolvents floated on the surface like tiny islands.
meanings.sent5: The insolvents formed a separate layer, distinct from the solvent.
